show.title: The Evil Dead (1981)
show.headline: The ultimate experience in grueling terror

event.title: <show-title>The Evil Dead (1981)</show-title>
event.headline: Sam Raimi's exuberant and gore-filled horror debut
event.description:
This Graveyard Shift presentation features an exclusive introduction from DEAD-heads Meagan Navarro (Bloody Disgusting) and Angel Melanson (Fangoria).

Big-time filmmaker Sam Raimi and big-chin actor Bruce Campbell knocked out their baby teeth on the movie that Stephen King famously called "the most most ferociously original horror film of 1982. Raimi, Campbell and their gang of THREE STOOGES-loving friends headed deep into the woods to scare up massively effective shocks on a miniscule budget. And when the first EVIL DEAD hit theaters, horror cinema was altered forever. Now, through the efforts of Grindhouse Releasing, THE EVIL DEAD has risen again to tear apart the big, big screen! Join not-quite-fearless warrior Ash in a fluid-soaked chainsaw-wielding battle with undead demonoids who possess, violate and kill using methods that would make Satan himself blush! It's the fright film that reinvented nightmares for an entire generation, and it's bigger, bloodier and backer than ever to tear your skull out through your eye sockets!

– Robert Saucedo, Graveyard Shift programmer

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Big Lebowski
show.headline: That rug really tied the room together

event.title: <show-title>The Big Lebowski</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: With themed props that’ll really tie the theater together.
event.description:
You want a Movie Party? We can get you a Movie Party, believe me. There are ways, Dude. You don't wanna know about it, believe me.

With its endlessly quotable dialogue, twist-filled mystery, and iconic characters, THE BIG LEBOWSKI has become a fixture of modern pop culture. That’s why we’re putting together a Movie Party to celebrate the greatness that is El Duderino (we’re not into the whole “brevity” thing).

When you arrive, we’ll provide you with an inflatable crowbar, so that you can treat your neighbor the way Walter treats Larry’s car, a bowling pin keychain to commemorate the forever-two-steps-behind Donny Kerabatsos, and some glow sticks that’ll make you feel like you’re a part of The Dude’s epic dream sequences.

So throw on your favorite shabby sweater and roll on down for THE BIG LEBOWSKI Movie Party. It’ll be far out.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

show.title: Selena
show.headline: Jennifer Lopez plays the queen of Tejano music

event.title: <show-title>Selena</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Feel the bidi bidi bom bom at this interactive screening
event.description:
Join us at this very special Movie Party as we celebrate the life and music of one of America’s most beloved icons, Selena Quintanilla-Pérez. Sure, we could just sit quietly and watch the magnificent 1997 film SELENA, starring Jennifer Lopez in a star-making performance. But we think the best way to honor Selena is to share in the joy of her music.

Whether you want to sing along or use any of the fun props we’ll have available when you arrive, you are strongly encouraged to lose yourself in all of Selena's classic songs while you enjoy the film. So throw on a rhinestone bra... oops, we mean bustier, and join us for a fun-filled night full of bidi bidi bom bom.

show.title: Josie And The Pussycats
show.headline: Conform! Free will is overrated! Jump on the bandwagon!

event.title: <show-title>Josie And The Pussycats</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Jump on the bandwagon and come rock with us
event.description:
Pulled from the pages of Archie Comics, JOSIE AND THE PUSSYCATS follows Josie (Rachel Leigh Cook), Val (Rosario Dawson), and Melody (Tara Reid) on their quest for stardom while remaining true to themselves, their fans, and their music. Written and directed by Harry Elfont and Deborah Kaplan (CAN'T HARDLY WAIT), JOSIE AND THE PUSSYCATS is a now nostalgic look at the early 2000s by way of the 1960s – with plenty of Snapple references, cat ears, and girl power to spare.

So put on some makeup, turn up the 8-track, and come rock out with us at the most glam movie party in town. We’ll supply the cat ears and the drumsticks.

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Popstar never stop never stopping still 01

portraitHeroImage.altText: Popstar never stop never stopping still 02

posterImages.altText: Popstar never stop never stopping poster 01

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine’s hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin’ tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That’s why we’re inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Sing-Along of all time (#sohumble). We’ll have inflatable microphones and onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, glow necklaces and ribbon wands to dance along, and an American flag for you to wave around during Conner’s erotic ode to patriotism. And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Sing-Along. You’ll be belting out all of Conner4Real’s greatest hits so loudly it’ll be like you just opened your Aquaspin refrigerator. DOINK DE DOINK!

show.title: Labyrinth
show.headline: The beloved '80s puppet fantasy film

event.title: <show-title>Labyrinth</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sing, quote, and dance (magic) dance all night long
event.description:
What could possibly be more magical than watching this iconic ‘80s fantasy conjured by Jim Henson, George Lucas, and David Bowie at the peak of their powers on the big screen? Feeling it come truly alive in a theater packed with fellow fans. At our interactive celebrations you’ll sing, quote, and dance (magic) dance the night away.

With on-screen subtitles and animated cues for the most memorable lines and for every song lyric, you can be sure the whole theater will be belting along with Bowie and shouting “YOU HAVE NO POWER OVER ME” along with Sarah at *just* the right moment. It’s the next best thing to Jareth the Goblin King actually showing up at your bedroom window.

show.title: Army of Darkness
show.headline: Trapped in time. Surrounded by evil. Low on gas.

event.title: <show-title>Army of Darkness</show-title>
event.headline: The greatest chin alive gets into some medieval mischief
event.description:
This Graveyard Shift presentation features an exclusive introduction from DEAD-heads Meagan Navarro (Bloody Disgusting) and Angel Melanson (Fangoria).

All primitive screwheads, listen up! Cult superstar Bruce Campbell (EVIL DEAD) reunites with director Sam Raimi to battle the deadly forces of evil in ARMY OF DARKNESS - the outrageous, effects-fueled action epic that will make you scream with fear and laughter. Forced to lead a makeshift Dark Ages army against the demonic Deadites, who possess all the deadly magic of hell, the shotgun-toting, chainsaw-armed, reluctant 20th century time traveler Ash (Campbell) must save the living from the dead, rescue his medieval girlfriend and get back to his own time. Don't miss a screening of one of the most popular horror comedies of all time.

– Robert Saucedo, Graveyard Shift programmer

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Evil Dead II
show.headline: The definitive horror-comedy of 1987… and all time

event.title: <show-title>Evil Dead II</show-title>
event.headline: You gotta hand it to 'em, 35 years is a hell of an achievement
event.description:
This Graveyard Shift presentation features an exclusive introduction from DEAD-heads Meagan Navarro (Bloody Disgusting) and Angel Melanson (Fangoria).

If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, then Sam Raimi must be the happiest man on earth. Not content with creating one of the most ferocious and ground-breaking lo-fi horror movies ever, Raimi one-upped himself by reimagining the original EVIL DEAD as a parody. And also a sequel. Most civilians would fail to see the point in such an undertaking. Thankfully, we're not most civilians. The gonzo, ultra-creative EVIL DEAD II reunites the iconic Ash (Bruce Campbell) with a possessed cabin in the woods. But this time, Raimi and co-writer Scott Spiegel weren't happy with simply fashioning chainsaws as hands, decapitating demons, and filling up rooms with blood. They wanted more! And so, the spirit of the original EVIL DEAD was combined with The Three Stooges to create the definitive horror-comedy of 1987 and also all years forever after infinity.

– Robert Saucedo, Graveyard Shift programmer

show.title: Dazed and Confused
show.headline: We get older, but DAZED AND CONFUSED stays great

event.title: <show-title>Dazed and Confused</show-title> <event-type-title>With Cast Reunion</event-type-title>
event.headline: Featuring an exclusive prerecorded Q&A with cast members and writer/director
event.description:
It’s been nearly three decades since the release of writer/director Richard Linklater’s timeless DAZED AND CONFUSED, the film that – along with SXSW and Austin Film Society – helped place Alamo Drafthouse’s hometown on the (film industry) map.

That’s why we’re honored that this April, stars Matthew McConaughey and Parker Posey will join Linklater and host Jack Black – recorded via Zoom – for a look back at a film that captured the look and the sounds of an entire generation.

show.title: A Hard Day's Night
show.headline: The Fab Four work like dogs in a rock 'n roll comedy adventure

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A hard days night sp hero

event.title: <show-title>A Hard Day's Night</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: The Fab Four work like dogs in a rock 'n roll comedy adventure
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

Meet the Beatles! Just one month after exploding onto the U.S. scene with their Ed Sullivan Show appearance, John, Paul, George, and Ringo began working on a project that would bring their revolutionary talent to the big screen.

A Hard Day’s Night, in which the bandmates play cheeky comic versions of themselves, captured the astonishing moment when they officially became the singular, irreverent idols of their generation and changed music forever. Directed with raucous, anything-goes verve by Richard Lester and featuring a slew of iconic pop anthems, including the title track, “Can’t Buy Me Love,” “I Should Have Known Better,” and “If I Fell,” A Hard Day’s Night, which reconceived the movie musical and exerted an incalculable influence on the music video, is one of the most deliriously entertaining movies of all time. (Janus Films)

show.title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch
show.headline: An anatomically incorrect rock odyssey

portraitHeroImage.altText: Hedwig and the Angry Inch BD

event.title: <show-title>Hedwig and the Angry Inch</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: Rock out and let your freak flag fly with the incomparable Hedwig
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

Got a sweet tooth? HEDWIG's got some sugar for ya.

In 2001, John Cameron Mitchell's adaptation of his own off-Broadway musical blitzkrieged its way into the hearts of losers, misfits, and rock 'n' rollers everywhere, a cult triumph of irreverence that created an entire army of worshipful Hedheads. Mitchell plays the East German transgender rock star who stands before us "in a divide between East and West, man and woman, slavery and freedom, top and bottom." And you'd better not try to tear her down.

With rollicking, endlessly catchy songs by Stephen Trask, singularly vibrant cinematography by Frank G. DeMarco, a wicked little sense of humor, and a message about staying true to yourself no matter what the world tries to take from you, HEDWIG AND THE ANGRY INCH is a beacon for the LGBT community and for anyone who has ever felt out of place.

So put on some makeup, turn up the eight-track, and pull that wig down from the shelf. HEDWIG's the punk-rock star of stage and screen, and she ain't never turning back!

show.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
show.headline: The next chapter begins

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: New Moon</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: The second installment, with brunch
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

The supernatural tale of star-crossed lovers continues as the Cullen family flees Forks in order to protect Bella (Kristen Stewart), and the heartbroken high-school senior discovers that vampires aren't the only creatures in town. Realizing that Bella will never be safe as long as he's around, Edward (Robert Pattinson) makes the difficult decision to leave his beloved behind shortly after her 18th birthday. Reeling from her loss, Bella embraces self-destruction after being comforted by Edward's image during a moment of mortal peril. But as heavy-hearted as Bella may be, her old friend Jacob (Taylor Lautner) distracts her from her sorrows by helping her renovate a weather-beaten motorbike. When Bella encounters a former adversary with a sizable grudge, she's rescued from harm at the last second by pack of enormous, ferocious wolves. Subsequently delving into the history of the Quileutes, Bella discovers the secrets of Jacob's tribe while looking forward to a reunion with Edward that may have deadly consequences.

show.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

show.title: Hot Fuzz
show.headline: Edgar Wright's silly deconstruction of the buddy cop genre

event.title: <show-title>Hot Fuzz</show-title> <event-type-title>15th Anniversary Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Big Cops. Small Town. Moderate Violence.
event.description:
By the power of Greyskull, join us for an interactive 15th anniversary celebration of director Edgar Wright’s balls-to-the-wall supercop comedy masterpiece, HOT FUZZ! Edgar Wright and his collaborators Simon Pegg and Nick Frost do to action cinema what they did to horror in SHAUN OF THE DEAD: They walk the cleverest of lines between homage, parody, and downright badass awesome. And when you model yourself after movies like POINT BREAK and BAD BOYS II, how could the results be anything but spectacular?

At these interactive “Movie Party” shows you’ll experience the awesomeness of Edgar Wright’s action-comedy with pre-movie shenanigans, themed props, and a conspiracy of surprises. Deal with it.

event.title: <show-title>The Lost City</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: The jungle isn't ready for this kind of brunch
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

Sandra Bullock (OCEAN’S EIGHT) and Channing Tatum (21 JUMP STREET) fake it ‘til they make it in this jungle adventure straight from the pages of your favorite romance novel. THE LOST CITY follows a reclusive author and her very committed cover model as they escape from the clutches of an eccentric billionaire (Daniel Radcliffe) seeking a lost treasure. Expect laughs, love, and hair flowing in the wind that would make Fabio proud.

THE LOST CITY follows in the grand cinematic tradition of inept adventurers falling into life-threatening situations with hilarious consequences. The loaded cast is lead by the always charming Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum, and supported by Daniel Radcliffe having an absolute blast playing the villain and Brad Pitt as an actually competent adventurer.

eventType.title: Special Menu
eventType.headline: Sink your teeth into your favorite films
eventType.description: From STAR WARS-themed milkshakes to twelve-hour LORD OF THE RINGS marathon feasts, our chefs whip up movie-inspired specials that’s like nothing else you’ve ever experienced.

show.title: On Cinema at the Cinema Special
show.headline: We've got the Oscar Fever. Hope you got it too.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Tim Heidecker and Gregg Turkington (dressed as The Joker)

portraitHeroImage.altText: Tim Heidecker and Gregg Turkington (dressed as The Joker)

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages including babies are welcome with parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.
